name: FiltererModulus
description: The FiltererModulus class is an event filterer that allows only every nth event to pass through, where n is the specified quotient.
overview:
The FiltererModulus class is an event filterer that allows only every nth event to pass through, where n is the specified quotient. This is useful for reducing event frequency or sampling events at regular intervals. Instances are typically created through JsMacros.createModulusEventFilterer() or by using the constructor directly.

Important Notes:
1. Event Type Agnostic: FiltererModulus can filter any event type.
2. Counter Reset: The internal counter resets to 0 each time an event passes through.
3. Positive Quotients: Negative values are automatically converted to positive values.
4. Thread Safety: Maintains internal state and should not be shared across listeners unintentionally.

constructors.description: Creates a new FiltererModulus instance that allows every nth event to pass through.

parameters.name: quotient
parameters.description: The modulus value - allows every nth event. Negative values are treated as positive.

methods.name: test
methods.description: Tests the event to see if it should pass the filter (matches the modulus counter).

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event to test against the filter.

methods.name: setQuotient
methods.description: Dynamically updates the modulus quotient value used for filtering.
